meanings.sent1: The soup had a tangs of spices that made it delicious.
meanings.sent2: The tangs of the lemon in the salad added a refreshing kick.
meanings.sent3: The tangs of the hot sauce made his eyes water, but he couldn't stop eating.
meanings.sent4: The tangs of nostalgia in her grandmother's cooking brought back fond memories.
meanings.sent5: The tangs of garlic and herbs filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.

meanings.definition: A sharp point or prong on a tool or weapon
meanings.sent1: He accidentally pricked his finger on the tangs of the fork.
meanings.sent2: The tangs of the rake helped him gather the leaves efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The tangs of the scissors were so sharp that they cut through paper easily.
meanings.sent4: The tangs of the arrowhead gleamed in the sunlight before hitting the target.
meanings.sent5: The tangs of the knife made it perfect for slicing through tough meat.

meanings.sent1: The tangs of the flowers in the garden filled the air with sweetness.
meanings.sent2: The tangs of the perfume lingered long after she left the room.
meanings.sent3: The tangs of the garbage made him hold his nose as he passed by.
meanings.sent4: The tangs of the ocean carried by the wind reminded him of childhood vacations.
meanings.sent5: The tangs of the bakery made his mouth water as he walked past.
